intro: Conyza caprariifolia, commonly known as the caprylic weed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It features a slender, branched stem that grows up to 1 meter in height, often with a pubescent surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and have a serrated margin. Conyza caprariifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
